comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
You might have to explain a bit more what you mean.

PowerShell by default already has intellisense provided through PSReadLine. Is it not showing up for some reason?

comments.author: SeeminglyScience
comments.body: @vexx32 technically intellisense refers to automatic suggestions like when typing in an editor.  PowerShell's tab completion often gets referred to as intellisense (I have bad habit of this) when it isn't really. The feature proposed in lzybkr/PSReadLine#687 would count, or something like the [PowerTab](https://github.com/jasonmarcher/PowerTab) project if it was triggered on key press.

comments.author: khoshroomahdi
comments.body: I have intellisense on ise but not in powershell

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: PSReadline is best place for the feature implementation.

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as external and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been be closed for housekeeping purposes.

title: Feature Request: intellisense in powershell windows
